Focus on: 1. Basic damage potential assessment...

dread_assessments.justification: High damage potential from unauthorized access, medium reproducibility due to potential authentication gaps, high exploitability with weak authentication, medium affected users (backend/system), and high discoverability via exposed endpoints.
recommendations: Implement OAuth2 or JWT for API authentication

dread_assessments.justification: High damage from data interception, medium reproducibility with unencrypted channels, high exploitability for eavesdropping, medium affected users (data flows), and high discoverability via network monitoring.
recommendations: Mandate TLS 1.2+ for all data transfers
Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit

dread_assessments.justification: High damage from malformed inputs, medium reproducibility with unvalidated payloads, high exploitability for injection attacks, medium affected users (model service), and high discoverability via input testing.

High damage from data exposure, medium reproducibility with weak access controls, high exploitability for database breaches, medium affected users (data stores), and high discoverability via network scanning.
recommendations: Enable audit logging for database access

dread_assessments.threat_title: Denial of Service via Resource Exhaustion
dread_assessments.justification: High damage from service unavailability, medium reproducibility with traffic amplification, high exploitability for DDoS attacks, medium affected users (model service), and high discoverability via network monitoring.
recommendations: Implement rate limiting and circuit breakers

summary: All identified threats exhibit high risk scores (39) due to significant damage potential, high exploitability, and widespread system impact. Prioritize implementing authentication, encryption, input validation, access controls, and DDoS protection to mitigate these risks.
